result.execSummary:
The defendant Julie J. Schuit was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julie J. Schuit

records.addlTxt: Revoked - Sentenced to CO jail/HOC

02:04 PM Defendant Julie J. Schuit in court with attorney Anne M. Katte. Defendant Julie J. Schuit in custody. Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 19CM103 & 15CF232. Sowinski/Katte statement to restitution. Case 19CM103 does not have a resolution and Katte to make date with JA. Sowinski/Katte/Court statement to sentencing. 

Court Sentence -

Jail - 1 year may be served in Vilas County
Jail Credit - 171 days
Court reduces any financial obligations to a civil judgement.
The court informs defendant of right to request expunction of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

Appeal rights given.
Payment plan application given.
Adj. 02: 24 PM
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 7, 2019 at 02:00 pm.

for Modification of Probation-includes cover letter

records.addlTxt:
10:25 a.m. Defendant Julie J. Schuit in court, in custody, with attorney Anne M. Katte. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court statement. Counsel in receipt of revocation summary. Kattie no changes. Schiek speaks to sentencing and motion to reinstate Ct. 2. Katte speaks to motion; does not oppose motion. Court speaks to DPA, takes judicial notice of revocation; grants State's motion; enters judgment. Katte/Schuit statement to sentencing. Court statement; denies inpatient treatment as part of sentence. $50 payments held until out of jail, approximately November. 

Court sentence - Cts. 1 & 3
7 mos. county jail - each case/concurrent w/Huber
118 days credit

Ct. 2
WHS
3 yrs. POP
Treatment as required by agent 
Remits costs
Appeal rights given
to reinstitute proceedings
and violation summary-
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.
DEJ

4:09 p.m. Defendant Julie J. Schuit in court with attorney Anne M. Katte.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf232 and 15cm395. Schiek states agreement. Plea questionnaire and DEJ filed. In 15cf232, State moves to amend Count 1 to violation of 943.14 - Criminal Tresspass to Dwelling - Granted. State moves to add Count 3 to Information - Entry into locked building, PTAC, a violation of 943.15 - A Misdemeanor - Granted. State moves to dismiss but read in 15cm395 in its entirety - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 and 3 in 15cf232. Count 2 of 15cf232 - Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists, accepts defendant's plea, defers judgment and accepts deferred agreement. Schiek/Katte/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. Schiek provides Victim Impact Statement in 15cm395 - Victim, AB, in 15cf232 statement in person. 
Court Sentence- Counts 1 and 3
WHS/POP - 2 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail - 30 days with Huber for all purposes. May serve in Oneida or Vilas County. To commence on/before Saturday May 28, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Bail continued. 
Adj. 4:41 p.m. 

  Review hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for March 19, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

2:14 p.m. Defendant Julie J. Schuit in court with attorney Anne M. Katte.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf232 and 15cm395. Schiek statement that Katte is waiting for medical records prior to resolution - Katte statement that resolution is close. Bail continued. Adj. 2:15 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter
- includes cover letter

11:42 a.m. Defendant Julie J. Schuit in court with attorney Anne M. Katte.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cm395 and 15cf232. State files Information. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Katte in receipt of Information - waives reading - pleads not guilty to both counts-requests pre-trial - Bail continued. Adj. 11:47 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
requesting new date for prelim
Preliminary hearing at 11-23-2015 11:30 am

1:30 p.m. Defendant Julie J. Schuit in court with attorney Anne M. Katte.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf232 and 15cm395.   In receipt of complaints, waive reading - not guilty plea - time limits waived on prelim in 15cf232. Status conference set in 15cm395 to track with 15cf232
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 11:45 am.
No contact with Amy Bella or Jessica Foreman or any residence 908 Acacia Lane, Rhinelander, WI.

2:11 p.m. Court Commissioner Bayne-Allison states that PD's office contacted Court - stated John Voorhees will be representing but Voorhees not available until 2:30 p.m. Adj. 2:12 p.m. 
3:12 p.m. Defendant Julie J. Schuit in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees appearing specially and states has a conflict - PD's office will appoint another attorney. Calling 15cf232 and 15cm395. Michlig statement to bond. In 15cf232 Court sets $5000 sig bond-No contact with Amy Bella or Jessica Foreman or any residence at 908 Acacia Lane, Rhinelander, WI.  In 15cm395, Court sets $500 sig bond - No entry upon Briar House premises.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:15 pm. Adj. 3:17 p.m.
